website_summaries.verdict: This aspirator is a basic model that is perfect to have around the house or to keep in a diaper bag.
pros: Easy to use and gentle on a baby’s nose
Comes at a low price point
Can also be used to clean out ear wax
cons: Tool does not disassemble for cleaning purposes

customer_reviews.title: Hospital grade!
customer_reviews.text: Mom of two, and I remember how hard it was when they were baby’s to find a nose sucker that actually sucked with force. By the time I had my second I remembered to bring the hospital grade one home with me. I’m now pregnant with my third and so happy Amazon is around to allow to order as many hospital grade nose suckers I can. However, this purchase was to help my husband unplug his ear that has been blocked with wax. Filled the bulb with warm water, repeatedly flushed, and by the third squeeze his ear was clear. Soft gentle tip worked perfect for placing in such a sensitive areA. Definitely will be purchasing more!!
customer_reviews.author: Ashia Holt

customer_reviews.title: Worthless
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a backup for the bulb syringe from the hospital after my son's birth. This came in an individually sealed package, however, I'm not sure how old it was because after 3 uses it busted open at the seam. Since it's a "medical device" it cannot be returned or refunded.
customer_reviews.author: S. L. ANGUS

customer_reviews.title: Don't throw these out!
customer_reviews.text: I use these in the shop to suck out brake fluid and squirt gas into small engine carbs to get them to run. I had one that lasted for YEARS until it got so stiff I couldn't squeeze it. They even make good blowers and I've used it for suction retrieving a small part. Used also for squirting cleaner onto carb parts to clean them and also squirting slime into bike and tire tubes when the pumper quit. Impervious to gas and brake fluid, how can you have a garage without one of these? I would imagine it would even work on what it was designed for although that sounds kinda yucky.
customer_reviews.author: BuckeyeFan80

customer_reviews.title: Very basic nose vacumm
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my newborn baby since they are always getting their nose blocked with snot. No matter how clean I get his nose within a few hours it will be back. There are very fancy Aspirators on the market. Some have great features like easier cleaning or different suction levels. This is a very BASIC aspirator that just works. Yes it will eventually get gross if you don't keep up with cleaning it. If you are looking for something cheap and easy that will work for a little while this is what you should buy.
customer_reviews.author: Dove Family

customer_reviews.title: Not so gentle
customer_reviews.text: As a first time parent I thought this was a great idea to use because these are what the hospital gives out. So must be great right? No. The suction is decent but with my baby it was too easy to go in the nose, which is bad because without a larger nasal side it goes too far and was rupturing blood vessels. As gross as the nose frida sounds to use, it has been more efficient and gentle on my baby. If you do choose this bulb suction for nasal use on infants just beware how far in it can go.
customer_reviews.author: AliciaA

customer_reviews.title: Get what ya pay for. It’s just ok
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping this was the same bulb they use at hospitals when you have your baby. It is not. Not as strong of a suction. My newborn gets HUGE booger’s stuck. I cannot see them, but you can hear her breathing is restricted through her nose. With much effort this gets the blockage. With much much less effort the nose frida is a life savor. I see why the frida costs what it does. Totally worth it. I mean this one is ok. It’s not great compared to the frida or hospital grade sucker.
customer_reviews.author: Tomi Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: The only one my daughter will use on her child. She tells me the other ones on the market do not work as well. My granddaughter has a lot of allergies and wakes up many times at night. Its sad when a baby is used to getting her nose suctioned all the time. This product is great and I try to keep one around at my house as well.
customer_reviews.author: Gypsy Girl

customer_reviews.title: Works Great to Clean Fountain Pens
customer_reviews.text: I've used it to clean several fountain pens and it makes it much easier and faster than just putting the section under the faucet or soaking.
customer_reviews.author: Harvey B

customer_reviews.title: Old product
customer_reviews.text: this came in an OLD sterilized package (probably from an old facility, I'm not sure), not sure when it was sterilized or if it had even been used before. Threw it away because it was gross looking
customer_reviews.author: rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Close to the one you get from the hospital
customer_reviews.text: For some reason, the ones from the hospital work better than any other ones I have found but this one is definitely a contender. This works well and cleans easy. My dog kept getting a hold of the ones I would buy from the store and finally I got this on and I protect it more because it works better. I would suggest this product
customer_reviews.author: shayla glenn

customer_reviews.title: It is a normal bulb syringe
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my dog who has bad allergies to try and suction his nose for the mucus. It is a normal bulb syringe but not so easy to clean. Best way is using a bowl of hot soapy water and just to constantly squeeze water in and out till it is clean.
customer_reviews.author: Mecheale

customer_reviews.title: Total trash
customer_reviews.text: Used this a total of three times and it split right open at the seam. Total garbage and not worth the $
customer_reviews.author: JNizzle

customer_reviews.title: Not like the ones in the hospital
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping this was just like the ones in the hospital but they are still not that strong and the material is tougher and hard to squeeze to get a good suction.
customer_reviews.author: R. Howe

customer_reviews.title: Broke first try
customer_reviews.text: Not worth the few dollars. Bought this because I get ear infections a lot so I needed to flush my ear. When this arrived it broke instantly and water squirted everywhere from all ends . Poorly made. I suggest either getting a better one or running to the store if possible to grab one
customer_reviews.author: TT

customer_reviews.title: Not safe to use with baby
customer_reviews.text: Not safe for babies. I wish that I had looked closer at the product description. Sucking is fine but the material is not safe to use for babies.
customer_reviews.author: Neen

customer_reviews.title: Unsafe, Potentially Dangerous
customer_reviews.text: This did not come in the original packaging and was repackaged before selling. There is no way I would use this product on my child and I am shocked a company would even attempt to repackage a medical device, especially in the time of COVID, and especially for use with an infant. Nowhere in the description does it suggest that the item was repackaged.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Mills

customer_reviews.title: Okay.
customer_reviews.text: Not quite the suction I had hoped for but at least I know it's durable enough not to start busting apart at the seams like the one I brought home from the hospital for my infant son. I bought it, I kept it, I'd purchase a sturdier one for a more powerful suction next time though.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Bennitt

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: Wish I could give it zero stars. I received it broken.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too small for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: Great quality but will work probably only for infants. Once the baby is a couple of months old it will probably be too small and won't suction well. The one we got from the hospital is much better
customer_reviews.author: Cevdet U.

customer_reviews.title: One Snot Sucker to Rule Them All
customer_reviews.text: It actually works! This is the closest to the one we got from the hospital, if not the exact same one. It's wrapped in a sterile package like a hospital product. We had been very disappointed with completely useless, and thewasn't much better. But this one works! I know that sometimes third-party sellers sell slightly different variations of the same item. The aspirator I bought was from Direct Care Store, and it was great. I immediately ordered two more. Made in China.
customer_reviews.author: Frank G.

customer_reviews.title: If you’re looking for a replacement to the amazing nose suckers they have at the hospital
customer_reviews.text: If you’re looking for a replacement to the amazing nose suckers they have at the hospital, this is it. After trying many terrible alternatives from various stores, I was ecstatic to find this here. It has a large enough hole to actually suck up the big guys, and enough sucking power get the job done rather than just make your baby mad.
customer_reviews.author: MF

customer_reviews.title: Similar to hospital version
customer_reviews.text: We were looking for one similar to what you get in the hospital. These are close but not quite it. They work for what you need them to. Not easy to clean at all. But overall it works.
customer_reviews.author: Eric and Ashley Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Don’t believe the 5 and 4 star reviews
customer_reviews.text: This thing has zero suction. I am baffled why it has so many 5 star reviews. It’s worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Faith B.

customer_reviews.title: Best ever!
customer_reviews.text: We wanted to be prepared, so we got a few different aspirators, in case our little guy got sick. Fast forward five months, our sweet baby got his first cold. We tried each aspirator we had and they were bad. They didn't suck anything out and he hated it. Desperate, I Googled "best baby aspirator." Everyone said to use the one that they give you at the hospital. We never got one from the hospital, but I also Googled what brand hospitals normally give and it's this one. It arrived and changed our lives. It sucks SO well and our son doesn't mind it. We are going to stock-up on these!
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Olson

customer_reviews.title: Good suction.
customer_reviews.text: This guy is a bit on the smaller size. At first I was put off by the size, as I am used to the hospital size suckers. But I use this for my baby all the time. The smaller size actually comes in pretty handy for tiny noses. The sucker from the hospital is too large for my babies nose, so this one is perfect. I bought two and keep one in the diaper bag and the other by babies bed.
customer_reviews.author: SekSeyK

customer_reviews.title: Must own item for new parents.
customer_reviews.text: I know when my youngest was born ...the hospital staff gave us one of these to help with the baby when she got stuffed up. Worked great till we LOST it. Then it was onto 3 different types...but we couldn't find any with the same suction as the original one. Sure enough i go on Amazon and by chance decide to roll the dice by looking it up...Viola! Bought 3 to make sure we wouldn't lose them....and even now 3 years later i still used it on the 3 year old when she has got pneumonia this past month. Plain looking but incredibly effective. Definitely something necessary for all new parents or parents to be.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.Mom

customer_reviews.title: It Worked!
customer_reviews.text: Recommended by the Vet for my doggy's ear. It worked great. Apparently water had gotten into ear, and aspirator worked great. He can hear me again. Bravo!!!
customer_reviews.author: Loyda Wright

customer_reviews.title: Great for baby
customer_reviews.text: When we first brought our baby home, he had reflux and these helped to get a lot of the spit up out of his mouth. Now we repurchase these and use them when he has boogers. We love these.
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlyn Purnell

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the hospital one...
customer_reviews.text: Not as good as the ones they give you at the hospital. Would not recommend or purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Lia Jones

customer_reviews.title: Gets The Boogies Out
customer_reviews.text: You can't not go wrong with the old fashion bulb syringe. My 5 month old grandsons nose is always full of boogies. When he comes to grandmas house I get busy cleaning his nose. Very easy to use just squeeze the air out, put the tip in babies nose and release. You can hear the yuck being pulled out of his nose. He doesn't much care for it but when I'm done, he can breath again.
customer_reviews.author: Kemberly

customer_reviews.title: good to have around
customer_reviews.text: Just like the ones in hospitals. These work so much better than any others that we've tried, but I hate having them too long since they get gross inside after a while (obviously, they suck buggers, right?) so it's nice that we can replace them so easily and inexpensively!
customer_reviews.author: Gwendolyn A.

customer_reviews.title: Last foe only a few usages
customer_reviews.text: The problem is it spits down the middle and opens up after 2 weeks usage!
customer_reviews.author: monica t

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt work well
customer_reviews.text: This doesnt work any better than the cheap one I got at Walmart. I thought it was a hospital grade bulb. It's also too wide at the tip and doesnt fit in my babies nose. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Marti

customer_reviews.title: It’s okay.
customer_reviews.text: Not clean cut edges on the actual part you put in the nose. Causes irritation to nasal passages because of this. Works like a bulb syringe would.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money, any syringe  like this should be considered disposable.
customer_reviews.text: Hard to love an ear syringe, (or whatever you're using this for) but after buying pretty much the same thing at a drugstore for $9 (returned it unused). and then finding that these should be considered disposable (mold and other hygiene issues, just google a bit about this or read reviews, a one piece unit like this can't be cleaned properly) it was great to find this for 1/4 the cost. If you use it a lot get a multi pack.
customer_reviews.author: Hewster

customer_reviews.title: Love these
customer_reviews.text: These are what our hospital sends home with us after baby is born. The work better then any bulb ive had (ive had 3 children and this is for my 2nd grandchild).
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Medline Aspirator - woohooo!
customer_reviews.text: This is the bulb that you get from the Hospital. After mine started getting this odd smell I tried one from a first aid kit and it was not at all useful. I went on a desperate search to find the one like I got from the hospital and found this! I am so happy I was able to replace my original one. I was debating on buying a few of them but was worried that I would not like this. I, now, wish I would have bought 2-3 more for just in case. When I go to replace this one I just got I definitely will buy more than one.
customer_reviews.author: AshleyKaye

customer_reviews.title: A must for parents with little ones
customer_reviews.text: These are like the ones that they have at the hospital. I wanted new ones and to have a extra one. They work better than the ones that come in the "new baby" kits they sell in stores.They work great at cleaning out little ones who get stuffed up. You have to make sure they get cleaned out after you use them because they can grow mold, but that is like any of the bulbs that are one piece and don't come apart. These are such a great price I only use them for a little while before I get rid of it and use a new one to prevent the mold issue tho.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley K

customer_reviews.title: Cracked from edge in 2 months
customer_reviews.text: After 2 months of usage (that too not that often), it just cracked from the edge. Could be just this one faulty piece, but totally disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Mehal Patel

customer_reviews.title: Clear Nose
customer_reviews.text: Great nasal aspirator for our newborn. This cleans out her nose well, the end is soft rubber so the baby seems comfortable when we use it. The only drawback is it's difficult to tell if the inside is completely clean but if you run it under water everything should come out.
customer_reviews.author: lisa

customer_reviews.title: Useful and sterile
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I had been searching for. Very useful. Could not locate in stores. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Number33

customer_reviews.title: This syringe is so much better than the ones you get in the baby stores
customer_reviews.text: This syringe is so much better than the ones you get in the baby stores. I keep two on hand with each baby. (On number 4) I've never had an emergency, but I know of parents who have/ When you are trying to clear your child's air way so they can breathe while the ambulance in on it's way, you'll be glad you have a syringe that works instead of the junk syringe that comes with your cheap first aid kit you got from your baby shower.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: It does what I need it for, cleaning part is more of water in water out situation not sure how else to clean it but eeeh
customer_reviews.author: Be

customer_reviews.title: 2 oz bulb not what you brought home with your newborn from the hospital
customer_reviews.text: BEWARE...this is NOT what they gave you at the hospital. This is a 2 oz bulb not the 3 oz bulb that you were given when you left the hospital with your newborn. I bought the wrong item even though it is marked as 2 oz. I was in a hurry and wanted a green 3 oz bulb AND a blue 3 oz bulb so each kid had his/her own and we weren't sharing germs. My bad .. I'll give it to my granddaughter for her babies.
customer_reviews.author: Lblazin

customer_reviews.title: Use with saline drops for best results. This is the best bulb we have ...
customer_reviews.text: Gets the job done every time. Use with saline drops for best results. This is the best bulb we have used (including the one they gave at the hospital). I got all nervous about bacteria, mold etc growing on the inside after seeing a Facebook post...so I cut ours open and there was NOTHING inside -- even though we had been using it for three months :) I ordered a bunch more to replace that one, one for the diaper bag, and some for baby showers!
customer_reviews.author: A. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Almost like hospital bulb
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these thinking these were the same size and type that we had in the hospital. They are the smaller size, but they work very well almost like the hospital bulbs. I've been pleased. I had a problem with the shipping. It was sent USPS so when it had been almost three weeks since the order I emailed the vendor. They were very quick to respond and checked on the order. It actually arrived a day later. Literally snail mail. The vendor was very nice. The shipping issue was out of their control. Again, nice customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Brown

customer_reviews.title: This thing sucks. And not like it should.
customer_reviews.text: Not happy with this aspirator. I have had several of these and they all usually "snap" back to shape rather quickly giving it the suction power it needs. This rubber is very soft and does not "spring" back to shape meaning snot doesn't get pulled it well. It is just bad. I do not recommend this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Chris1683

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Super fast shipping.
customer_reviews.text: We got a blue one at the baby shower and we took the white one from the hospital. The hospital one was the same as the Safety First one from walmart but with a Red Cross logo on it and did not work at all so I was very thankful that we got a different one at the shower. Over the christmas holiday we lost the blue one in all the traveling. This must be the same brand as the one we had because it works just like the other one. It does just what it is supposed to do and the suction is great! They ship really fast too. We ordered on Fri and received it on Mon.
customer_reviews.author: the dragon lady

customer_reviews.title: Much better than Safety 1st
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this because the syringe we have from Safety 1st had horrible suction and could barely suction most of the time inside the nose. When I got this one, I squeezed it and immediately knew it would be a LOT better, and it is. I took off 1 star only because the tip of it didn't look entirely smooth, like it might scrape the inside of my baby's nose. So far it doesn't seem like it did any damage. =] And since it works a lot better, my baby doesn't have to sit through it as much because I don't have to keep trying over and over again.
customer_reviews.author: KatzeX3

customer_reviews.title: Too big to use on babies
customer_reviews.text: This product was nothing like the one hospital gave out. The nose end was bigger than the hospital one - I wouldn't want to put this on my little one's tiny nose. Plus the product seemed to be less well made than the hospital one.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Amazing, these are life savers
customer_reviews.text: These are the best aspirators you will ever find I am telling you! My daughter was in the NICU for a while and these were the kind they had and they and powerful and they get the stuff out unlike the ones I bought from Target and Walmart that do basically Nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Mallory

customer_reviews.title: Good suction and volume
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product with excellent suction and volume. It is very durable. You can't really clean the inside very easily.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew K.

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS ONE OF THE WORST BULBS I HAVE EVER USED. IT LOOKS LIKE THE ONES IN THE HOSPITAL (DAVOL NAME ON TOP OF BULB.) BUT THE BULB DOES NOT RETRACT ONCE RELEASED, LEAVING MUCUS IN THE NASAL CAVITY. GOING IN THE TRASH. (MADE IN CHINA ON TOP OF THIS BULB)
customer_reviews.author: Grrrrrr

customer_reviews.title: Not the best, but still usable
customer_reviews.text: Compared to the one that they use in the hospital, the material of this one is a bit thinner, and the suction was not that strong but still usable.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Greer

customer_reviews.title: Great nasal sucker
customer_reviews.text: This is very similar if not the same as what I got from the hospital to get snot out from my baby. Works great on a child that can't blow their nose when they are sick. Great product and good quality!
customer_reviews.author: DG

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't suck...which sucks! Haha.
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I got a bad one but it doesn't suck out anything from my son's nose. Just gets him upset and mom frustrated. Horrible product. Now have to purchase a different one while my poor baby shorts with his stuffy nose. Don't waste your time not worth the $1.
customer_reviews.author: Schultz

customer_reviews.title: No comparison...
customer_reviews.text: I have tried many of these types of products since losing the one I recieved after having my baby. None of them even came close to working as well as this one. So glad I found it on Amazon as I could not find it in stores. Tip: to get best suction place index and middle finger on opposite sides of the base of the nozzle. Push up with thumb on the very bottom of bulb and then release thumb to receive the best suction.
customer_reviews.author: MHWiley

customer_reviews.title: Threw them away
customer_reviews.text: I washed these in soap and water before use. Glad I did because the water came out rusty looking. Threw them in the trash right away!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Hospital grade, good quality!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for the same quality hand suction bulb we carry at our hospital (I'm a nurse!) And this is it! Great quality, not cheaply made like some bulbs you get when you buy an "infant grooming kit"
customer_reviews.author: M&K Wermert

customer_reviews.title: JUST like what we got from the hospital.
customer_reviews.text: My aspirator from the hospital got destroyed by my parents dog while they were visiting. Bought nearly every kind of aspirator I could find in town, none of them worked even half as well as the one I got from the hospital. I will be purchasing more of these for baby gifts and for future babies of my own! My newborn had issues with choking on her spit up so we needed a good aspirator .It was a life saver!
customer_reviews.author: Tbigalke

customer_reviews.title: Smaller size
customer_reviews.text: It’s almost the same as the ones from the hospital except that this is smaller in size. I guess I did not double check the size before I ordered but this will do for now.
customer_reviews.author: darL g

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to clean my pugs nose and it works wonders.
customer_reviews.author: Bezabed Y. Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: It's ok. It does its job
customer_reviews.text: Didnt no I was using it wrong at first. It's doing the job. Very easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Nocilia louis

customer_reviews.title: Contains phalate DEHP
customer_reviews.text: Wouldn't have purchased had I known it had DEHP, I didn't see it in the description, can't speak to its effectiveness.
customer_reviews.author: Clare

customer_reviews.title: Not same as hospital; better than "safety 1st" brand
customer_reviews.text: This is different from the one I got from the hospital - marked "DAVOL". But it seems about as good. The "Safety 1st" brand just doesn't work. When I compare the three, the hospital one and this one both pulled in air at about the same time. While the safety 1st one took about 1/2 second to pull in air. Even worst it doesn't work in temperatures below room temperature.
customer_reviews.author: S. L.

customer_reviews.title: Works wonders.
customer_reviews.text: This work really good, I use it for cleaning my fountain pens and it works wonders.
customer_reviews.author: Barbie

customer_reviews.title: Value
customer_reviews.text: Cheapest I could find. Just need it for occasional ear cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: B C Berger

customer_reviews.title: good suction
customer_reviews.text: great buy just like the one that was given to us from the hospital
customer_reviews.author: C love

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I bought so many fancy ones but this is the best.
customer_reviews.author: Hoang Ho

customer_reviews.title: Hospital Equivalent - Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: My dog ate the one I received from the hospital when my daughter was born. This is very similar, but not as large. It is soft and flexible, and gentle on my baby's nose. It doesn't have an opening for cleaning, but I just pour boiling water into a cup and aspirate it, shake it, and squeeze it out. The hot water evaporates and leaves it clean and dry for next use. You can't beat the price!
customer_reviews.author: Karaday

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: This works good, reminds me of the ones you get at the hospital
customer_reviews.author: LCN

customer_reviews.title: Well made!
customer_reviews.text: I use this to flush out old ink in my fountain pens. Very easy to clean and very well made.
customer_reviews.author: jadebutterfly

customer_reviews.title: Great suction power for cleaning little noses.
customer_reviews.text: This bulb works great. Our son suffers from allergies and we suck out his nose (with nasal spray) several times a day. We bought this one to replace our original bulb (which actually split in half in the end) and the suction is much better.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Price

customer_reviews.title: Poor suction
customer_reviews.text: The suction is terrible. I was pretty disappointed and don’t use it as I can get enough suction to use properly.
customer_reviews.author: Amelia

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work well so far!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this one for a couple of months now and so far it is holding up. It is very flexible, not as stiff as the one from the hospital. Thinner material, I guess. Works well for getting stuff that's deep in there, unlike a larger one I bought at the same time on here. It remains to be seen just how long it will actually last before splitting apart, as they all ultimately do. But for now I recommend it, especially for the price (as long as it remains low).
customer_reviews.author: Rehta

customer_reviews.title: Does its job
customer_reviews.text: Used with earwax removal aid drops, it did it's job. I am however not sure that it can be cleaned well and probably stores bacterias inside (since it cannot be opened and cleaned thoroughly)
customer_reviews.author: CaféÔLait

customer_reviews.title: Works well for cleaning your fountain pen
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to clean out the nib in my fountain pen. This bulb syringe works great. It holds about 2 oz. of water. That's enough to flush my pen a couple of times which cleans it perfectly. Happy.
customer_reviews.author: CopperKat

customer_reviews.title: Thanks for the reviews!
customer_reviews.text: Without your reviews, I would have never been able to discern online which is the coveted hospital-style bulb syringe that has lasted me 7 years! I have had the others that don't suck and are too rubbery or not rubbery enough, but my teeny hospital one and this one were the best! I just bought this for a new mom as her backup. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: LJMom

customer_reviews.title: Arrived defective
customer_reviews.text: The bulb arrived open at the seam. Unable to use. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: P. Simons

customer_reviews.title: suction
customer_reviews.text: suction is awesome. Just like the ones you get from the hospitals. the store bought ones never have enough suction power. I definitely will order again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Pudmini Xiong

customer_reviews.title: Not very great
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t have very powerful suction. I like the hospital ones better
customer_reviews.author: hope S.

customer_reviews.title: Fits a 4+-month-olds nose
customer_reviews.text: The hospital told us to use it for a newborn's spit-up and it was great for that purpose. However, it does not fit a newborn's nostril so as a nasal aspirator it failed.
customer_reviews.author: Ene-Liis teppo

customer_reviews.title: Popped open after only a few uses.
customer_reviews.text: I literally got this bulb syringe today and after only a few squeezes, the side popped open. Thankfully I don't need to ship it back to Amazon for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Philip D Gilston

customer_reviews.title: It is a good product
customer_reviews.text: It’s tough to suck a dogs nose just what I asked for
customer_reviews.author: RickandAmyplus3

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: This is similar to the quality of the one I got from the hospital.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Must have for little ones.
customer_reviews.text: I buy a ton of these because they are inexpensive and work really well. My little one gets allergies really bad and it's able to blow her nose on her own yet so these are a necessity at our house. They have suction power similar to those that you get at the hospital. We've tried many brands of these and this is by far our favorite.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Works well and seems to be same one given at the hospital newborn
customer_reviews.author: trd528

customer_reviews.title: I wanted one just like they used in the hospital when the babies are ...
customer_reviews.text: this little sucker, I searched hard for. I wanted one just like they used in the hospital when the babies are born. that initial booger sucker they use is thechampion and not too many work as well... except for this one. so if youre looking for that sucker that ya used at the hospital this is the one you buys. its everything and moe!!
customer_reviews.author: Kristy Lang

customer_reviews.title: Too large to fit in newborn nose
customer_reviews.text: I kicked myself for forgetting the hospital suction bulb and the ones at the store had large holes that didn't fit in my 3 week old's nose. From the reviews I though this could work but it was the same problem. Not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Lawless

customer_reviews.title: Loved it, Loved it, Loved it
customer_reviews.text: This syringe which is similar to the one I got at the hospital after having my baby is the best in the market. I love this bugger sucker! I tried buying a different kind at the store but none compared to this one and ended up returning them. I am glad to have found one on amazon, and the price was great so I bought a few to keep in my diaper bags and at home.
customer_reviews.author: Brooklyn Girl

customer_reviews.title: Okay
customer_reviews.text: Suction isn’t great and it’s probably only good for newborn and premie noses
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: These were recommended by the nurses at my prenatal classes. I keep one in every area where the baby is fed and they've been extremely useful and a peace of mind. Easy to suck milk from baby's mouth and nose when she drinks too quickly. Good value for the price as well.
customer_reviews.author: Paula

customer_reviews.title: Many uses
customer_reviews.text: I bought the nasal aspirator, bulb syringe to flush our dogs ears and it works quite well. I clean the bulb with alcohol both inside and out when finished with the dogs.
customer_reviews.author: George M.

customer_reviews.title: Broke on second use
customer_reviews.text: It’s a basic baby necessity that worked well the first time we used it, and split in half the second time. Not good quality, apparently!
customer_reviews.author: Hanbanan

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 3 days
customer_reviews.text: After 3 days of normal use, it broke. Ripped and broke along the seam or "equator" of the product.
customer_reviews.author: Adam W

customer_reviews.title: Hospital grad suction
customer_reviews.text: The suction is amazing I only use this! I was using the nose frida but this gets the job done more efficiently
customer_reviews.author: Jon Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Great for cleaning pens
customer_reviews.text: Great price for a very simple device. This works very well for cleaning pens and the price is wonderful
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Very good ear syringe
customer_reviews.text: Ever since I was in I was in the Navy and had to work in deafening conditions, I've had trouble with wax buildup in my right ear. I've owned a couple of ear syringes over the years. This one works as any I've ever had. I would not hesitate to order one again if this one ever wears out!
customer_reviews.author: Karvin Spurgeon

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use easy to clean... but is it actually clean
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use easy to clean, but can’t tell if it’s completely clean
customer_reviews.author: TTRIB

customer_reviews.title: Best bulb syringe around
customer_reviews.text: This bulb syringe is the best I've found. Way better than anything you can get at Target or BRU, and less bulky than the one the hospital sent me home with. I was so pleased with the first one I ordered, I ordered two more to keep around the house and in the diaper bag. My doctor was so impressed with it when I brought my little one in with her first cold, that she asked me where I got it so she could refer other patients.
customer_reviews.author: tdb500

product_meta.title: Briggs Baby Nasal Aspirator, Ear Syringe, Snot Sucker, Mucus Sucker and Nasal Bulb Syringe, 2 Ounces
product_meta.description:
BRIGGS BABY NASAL ASPIRATOR, BULB SYRINGE, EAR WAX SYRINGE

Keep Your Infant's Airways and Ears Clean and Safe

BRIGGS BABY NASAL ASPIRATOR BENEFITS:

Helps your newborn breathe easier Easy to use Easy to clean Also works as an ear wax syringe BRIGGS BABY NASAL ASPIRATOR, BULB SYRINGE, SPECIFICATIONS:

2 by 5.3 by 5.3 inches Weighs 1.6 ounces How To Clean Your Baby Nasal Aspirator, Bulb Syringe, Ear Wax Syringe:

Be sure to clean the syringe well after each use. Suction up some warm soapy water and shake it around. Follow with plain water then squeeze out as much as possible. Allow to dry by standing it up, tip down.

WARRANTY AND GUARANTEE:

Amazon Exclusive Limited warranty may apply. Please see product for additional details. Click Add To Cart Today
feature_bullets: EASILY CLEAR YOUR BABY'S AIRWAYS, cleaning their nasal passages of mucus, just like at the hospital, now at home. FSA eligible.
GREAT NASAL ASPIRATOR FOR NEWBORNS AND INFANTS, at the perfect size, holding 2 ounces.
ALSO WORKS AS AN EAR WAX SYRINGE, allowing you to keep your baby's ears clean and clear, helping to prevent infections.
YOUR BULB SYRINGE HELPS YOUR INFANT BREATHE EASIER, keeping your newborns nose clear. Plus, it's very easy to clean and reuse.

WARRANTY AND GUARANTEE: Amazon Exclusive Limited warranty may apply. Please see product for additional details. NOTE: Note: we can only guarantee the quality of this product when sold through Amazon.com or Brazos Walking Sticks.
